word: THE GENERAL DISTINCTION BETWEEN CLEAN AND UNCLEAN MEATS IN ADVENTIST CIRCLES REMAINED UNDEVELOPED THROUGHOUT THE NINETEENTH CENTURY. WHILE ADVENTISTS ARGUED VIGOROUSLY AGAINST PORK, THE WEIGHT OF THEIR ARGUMENT CONTINUED TO BE CARRIED BY PHYSIOLOGICAL CRITERIA. URIAH SMITH EXPLICITLY REJECTED THE APPLICABILITY OF THE MOSAIC DISTINCTION: "WE BELIEVE THERE IS BETTER GROUND ON WHICH TO REST [THE PROHIBITION ON PORK] THAN THE CEREMONIAL LAW OF THE FORMER DISPENSATION, FOR IF WE TAKE THE POSITION THAT THAT LAW IS STILL BINDING, WE MUST ACCEPT IT ALL, AND THEN WE SHALL HAVE MORE ON OUR HANDS THAN WE CAN EASILY DISPOSE OF."
